testcase.brief: Unit Test 0105: Creating new user-profile and putting clients on new VLAN should work
testcase.description:
Pre-Condition: After WANAddressing_UnitTest_ConfigCLI_4
Test Procedure: create a new user-profile with VLAN 2, create a security-object test-vlan with attribute 2, create a new ssid test-vlan, set ssid test-vlan to reference the security-object CLI commands: user-profile test-vlan vlan-id 2 attribute 2 security-object test-vlan security-object test-vlan default-user-profile-attr 2 ssid test_vlan ssid test_vlan security-object test-vlan interface wifi0 ssid test-vlan save config

step.desc: Configure AP Enable 1 dhcp server（mgt0.1） Mgt0.1 vlan10 IPaddr 10.1.10.1 gateway 10.1.10.1 Laptop1 connect to Mgt0.1 IPaddr 10.1.10.2
step.telnet: -v "interface mgt0.1 vlan ${br1.vpc2.vlan}" -v "interface mgt0.1 ip ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server enable" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dns-server enable" -v "dns server-ip ${pub.dns1.ip}"
-v "user-profile fw11 qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc2.vlan} attribute 1" -v "interface eth1 mode bridge-access user-profile-attribute 1"

step.desc: br1.vpc1 show ip address got from mgt0 dhcp client
set br1.vpc1.tif.ip var for vpc2 on BR side
Check PC get correct IP in the ip pool
